private_information: I hold disks A,B,C,D,E,F,G ordered top-to-bottom (A smallest, G largest)
left_peg.goal: Provide an accurate, structured description of the left peg contents.

middle_peg.goal: Provide an accurate, structured description of the middle peg contents.

right_peg.goal: Provide an accurate, structured description of the right peg contents.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that models the 7-disk Tower of Hanoi instance and achieves the goal configuration (move all disks from left to right).

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 7 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G from smallest (A) to largest (G).
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
A larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: right peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G; left and middle pegs empty.

describe.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the left peg. Provide a concise, structured description of the contents of your peg as a simple list of disk labels in top-to-bottom order. Do not produce PDDL. Focus only on the local peg state.
describe.prompt: Your name is left_peg. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->left_peg->private_information}. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Your task: {agents->left_peg->goal}. Return the peg contents as a JSON-style list string such as ["A","B","C"].

describe.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the middle peg. Provide a concise, structured description of the contents of your peg as a simple list of disk labels in top-to-bottom order. Do not produce PDDL. Focus only on the local peg state.
describe.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->middle_peg->private_information}. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Your task: {agents->middle_peg->goal}. Return the peg contents as a JSON-style list string such as ["A","B","C"] or [] for empty.

describe.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the right peg. Provide a concise, structured description of the contents of your peg as a simple list of disk labels in top-to-bottom order. Do not produce PDDL. Focus only on the local peg state.
describe.prompt: Your name is right_peg. You have the following private knowledge: {agents->right_peg->private_information}. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Your task: {agents->right_peg->goal}. Return the peg contents as a JSON-style list string such as ["A","B","C"] or [] for empty.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL authoring. Your job is to integrate the peg state reports and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem specifically tailored for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Model pegs and disks explicitly, include clear action schemas for moving the top disk from one peg to another with preconditions enforcing single-disk moves and the size ordering constraint. Ensure the produced PDDL is complete and solvable for the 7-disk instance.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive structured peg states from the three peg agents: {workflow->left_peg->describe->output}, {workflow->middle_peg->describe->output}, and {workflow->right_peg->describe->output}. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Your objective is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Combine the inputs to generate a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep action names and predicates clear and unambiguous.
